title: DPIA Requirement Check
description: Logic flow to determine whether a DPIA is likely required based on jurisdiction and processing risk.

jurisdiction.text: Which jurisdiction applies to this processing?

No clear privacy law / unsure.explanation: Jurisdiction does not have a formal DPIA requirement. You may still conduct a privacy risk assessment as good practice.

eu_personal_data.text: Does the processing involve personal data?

No.explanation: No personal data processed under UK/EU GDPR → no DPIA required.

eu_high_risk.text: Does the processing meet any high-risk criteria (e.g., large-scale processing, vulnerable subjects, automated decision-making, special category data)?

Yes.explanation: Processing activity meets GDPR high-risk criteria → DPIA is legally required.

No.explanation: Processing is personal data but not high-risk. DPIA not mandatory but recommended for assurance.

generic_personal_data.text: Does the processing involve personal or sensitive data?

No.explanation: No personal/sensitive data → no DPIA requirement under most privacy laws.

generic_risk.text: Is the processing likely to pose a risk to individual rights (e.g., biometric use, profiling, third-party sharing)?

Yes.explanation: High-risk processing under general privacy laws → a privacy impact assessment is recommended.

No.explanation: No significant risks identified → DPIA not required.
